title: What happens if the college gets approved by NAAC accreditation grades B+? What are the advantages of NAAC accreditation? - Quora
tags: Modern Education Society's College of Engineering

response.answer_text: The grades awarded by NAAC shall reflect the quality of education offered, the infrastructure created and the status of the faculty recruited by the institute. As we have grades awarded for the examinations conducted like First class with Distinction, First class, Second class, etc. NAAC provides grades like A+, A, B+, B etc. For any institution it is very important to get accreditation first and later look to what grade has been awarded. Because there are so many institutions in the country which have not applied for accreditation itself. University Grants Commission (UGC) established National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) as an autonomous body to assess and accredit institutions of higher education offering any program. Accreditation granted by NAAC helps the institution to approach UGC and apply for - Autonomous college status Deemed university status Inclusion under section 2(f) for funds from UGC Inclusion under section 12(B) for Central government funds Funds for NAAC sponsored seminars on specific topics
